critique: The most likely diagnosis is osteoarthritis (Option B). This patient's radiograph shows typical findings of osteoarthritis, including asymmetric joint-space narrowing of the left hip (with narrowing worse in the superior aspect of the joint), mild subchondral sclerosis, subchondral cysts, and small osteophytes.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question_text: A 70-year-old man is evaluated for left groin pain with walking.A radiograph of the hips is shown.
